title: Avio secures Italian government funding for methane engine and small launch vehicle prototype
summary: Avio is moving ahead with efforts to develop a larger methane-fueled rocket engine and a prototype small launch vehicle with more than $300 million in funding from the Italian government.

title: NRO Signs 5 Year Commercial Hyperspectral Satellite Imagery Agreement
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office (NRO) has entered into five-year agreements with six commercial providers of hyperspectral satellite imagery.

title: USSF Requests First Tactically Responsive Space Program Budget
summary: The U.S. Space Force has requested $60 million over the next two years from Congress for a program called tactically responsive space, according to budget documents submitted last week.

title: Innospace Test Launches HANBIT-TLV From Brazil Successfully
summary: South Korean rocket startup Innospace has successfully launching its HANBIT-TLV suborbital rocket from Brazil's Alcântara Space Center for the first time.

title: NRO signs agreements with commercial providers of hyperspectral imagery
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office has signed five-year agreements with six commercial providers of hyperspectral satellite imagery

title: Relativity targets nighttime window for next Terran 1 launch attempt
summary: Relativity Space is preparing for a third launch attempt for the first flight of its Terran 1 rocket Wednesday, in an effort to become the first 3D-printed and methane-fueled rocket to reach orbit. The Good Luck, Have Fun (GLHF) mission is now scheduled for liftoff from Launch Complex 16 (LC-16) at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in a window from 10:00 PM EDT Wednesday to 1:00 AM EDT Thursday (02:00 to 05:00 UTC Thursday).

title: Virgin Orbit raising $200 million from investor Matthew Brown, closing deal as soon as Thursday
summary: Virgin Orbit is in final talks to raise funds from Texas-based investor Matthew Brown, two people familiar with the deal told CNBC, amounting to an injection of $200 million.

title: Relativity Space hopes to live additively ever after with Wednesday’s launch
summary: Watch this one because there won't be many Terran 1 launches.

title: Virgin Orbit begins “incremental” return to work as it seeks new funding
summary: A small set of Virgin Orbit employees will return to work after a week-long furlough as the company attempts to raise money to remain solvent.

title: Teens send experiments out of this world
summary: From the time she was a child, Anna-Sophia Boguraev has had her eye on space. When she was 4, she built a cardboard rocket ship. She asked a lot of questions, loved looking at the stars and was set on getting a PhD long before most kids knew what that meant. The daughter of two […]
